intro: Silene racemosa var. rubrflora, commonly known as the red-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene racemosa var. rubrflora is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
